verses.verse: Come down <S%H3381><s%>, and sit <S%H3427><s%> in the dust <S%H6083><s%>, O virgin <S%H1330><s%> daughter <S%H1323><s%> of Babylon <S%H894><s%>, sit <S%H3427><s%> on the ground <S%H776><s%>: there is no throne <S%H3678><s%>, O daughter <S%H1323><s%> of the Chaldeans <S%H3778><s%>: for you shall no more <S%H3254><s%> be called <S%H7121><s%> tender <S%H7390><s%> and delicate <S%H6028><s%>.

Take <S%H3947><s%> the millstones <S%H7347><s%>, and grind <S%H2912><s%> meal <S%H7058><s%>: uncover <S%H1540><s%> your locks <S%H6777><s%>, make bare <S%H2834><s%> the leg <S%H7640><s%>, uncover <S%H1540><s%> the thigh <S%H7785><s%>, pass over <S%H5674><s%> the rivers <S%H5104><s%>.

Your nakedness <S%H6172><s%> shall be uncovered <S%H1540><s%>, Yes <S%H2781><s%>, your shame shall be seen <S%H7200><s%>: I will take <S%H3947><s%> vengeance <S%H5359><s%>, and I will not meet <S%H6293><s%> you as a man <S%H120><s%>.
As for our redeemer <S%H1350><s%>, the Lord <S%H3068><s%> of hosts <S%H6635><s%> is his name <S%H8034><s%>, the Holy One <S%H6918><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%>.

Sit <S%H3427><s%> you silent <S%H1748><s%>, and get <S%H935><s%> you into darkness <S%H2822><s%>, O daughter <S%H1323><s%> of the Chaldeans <S%H3778><s%>: for you shall no more <S%H3254><s%> be called <S%H7121><s%>, The lady <S%H1404><s%> of kingdoms <S%H4467><s%>.

I was angry <S%H7107><s%> with my people <S%H5971><s%>, I have polluted <S%H2490><s%> my inheritance <S%H5159><s%>, and given <S%H5414><s%> them into your hand <S%H3027><s%>: you did show <S%H7760><s%> them no mercy <S%H7356><s%>; upon the ancient <S%H2205><s%> have you very <S%H3966><s%> heavily <S%H3513><s%> laid your yoke <S%H5923><s%>.

And you said <S%H559><s%>, I shall be a lady <S%H1404><s%> for ever <S%H5769><s%>: so that you did not lay <S%H7760><s%> these things to your heart <S%H3820><s%>, neither did remember <S%H2142><s%> the latter end of it <S%H319><s%>.

Therefore hear <S%H8085><s%> now this <S%H5719><s%>, you that are given to pleasures, that dwell <S%H3427><s%> carelessly <S%H983><s%>, that say <S%H559><s%> in your heart <S%H3824><s%>, I am <S%H657><s%>, and none else beside me <S%H3427><s%>; I shall not sit as a widow <S%H490><s%>, neither shall I know <S%H3045><s%> the loss of sons <S%H7908><s%>:

But these two <S%H8147><s%> things shall come <S%H935><s%> to you in a moment <S%H7281><s%> in one <S%H259><s%> day <S%H3117><s%>, the loss of sons <S%H7908><s%>, and widowhood <S%H489><s%>: they shall come <S%H935><s%> upon you in their perfection <S%H8537><s%> for the multitude <S%H7230><s%> of your sorceries <S%H3785><s%>, and for the great <S%H3966><s%> abundance <S%H6109><s%> of your enchantments <S%H2267><s%>.

For you have trusted <S%H982><s%> in your wickedness <S%H7451><s%>: you have said <S%H559><s%>, None sees <S%H7200><s%> me <S%H2451><s%>. Your wisdom and your knowledge <S%H1847><s%>, it has perverted <S%H7725><s%> you <S%H559><s%>; and you have said in your heart <S%H3820><s%>, I am <S%H657><s%>, and none else beside me.

Therefore shall evil <S%H7451><s%> come <S%H935><s%> upon you <S%H3045><s%>; you shall not know from from where it rises <S%H7837><s%>: and mischief <S%H1943><s%> shall fall <S%H5307><s%> upon you <S%H3201><s%>; you shall not be able to put it off <S%H3722><s%>: and desolation <S%H7722><s%> shall come <S%H935><s%> upon you suddenly <S%H6597><s%>, which you shall not know <S%H3045><s%>.

Stand <S%H5975><s%> now with your enchantments <S%H2267><s%>, and with the multitude <S%H7230><s%> of your sorceries <S%H3785><s%>, where <S%H834><s%> you have labored <S%H3021><s%> from your youth <S%H5271><s%>; if so be you shall be able <S%H3201><s%> to profit <S%H3276><s%>, if so be you may prevail <S%H6206><s%>.

You are wearied <S%H3811><s%> in the multitude <S%H7230><s%> of your counsels <S%H6098><s%>. Let now the astrologers <S%H1895><s%>, the stargazers <S%H2374><s%>, the monthly <S%H2320><s%> prognosticators <S%H3045><s%>, stand up <S%H5975><s%>, and save <S%H3467><s%> you from these things that shall come upon you <S%H935><s%>.

Behold <S%H7179><s%>, they shall be as stubble; the fire <S%H784><s%> shall burn <S%H8313><s%> them <S%H5337><s%>; they shall not deliver themselves <S%H5315><s%> from the power <S%H3027><s%> of the flame <S%H3852><s%>: there shall not be a coal <S%H1513><s%> to warm <S%H2552><s%> at <S%H217><s%>, nor fire to sit before it <S%H3427><s%>.

Thus shall they be unto you with whom you have labored <S%H3021><s%>, even your merchants <S%H5503><s%>, from your youth <S%H5271><s%>: they shall wander <S%H8582><s%> every one <S%H376><s%> to his quarter <S%H5676><s%>; none shall save you <S%H3467><s%>.
